question.text: Which one of the following crosses shows the phenotypic ratio of 3:1?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></math>

solution.text:
When parents of genotype Aabb is crossed with Aabb we get the following progenies.
 
  Ab ab
Ab AAbb Aabb
ab Aabb aabb

Phenotypic ratio will be 3:1
Genotypic ratio will be 1:2:1
